Here is a question relating to modal logic:

Suppose there are five possible worlds, and a proposition p is true in two of those worlds. What is the percentage of possible worlds in which p is true?
message_2:
To find the percentage of possible worlds in which the proposition p is true, you can use the following formula:

( Number of worlds where p is true / Total number of possible worlds ) * 100

In this case, p is true in 2 worlds out of 5 possible worlds. So the calculation would be:

( 2 / 5 ) * 100 = 0.4 * 100 = 40%

The proposition p is true in 40% of the possible worlds.
